lexUnit.name: indicative.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: serving as a sign or indication

sentence.text: The fact that a man was prepared to drive a completely unnecessary 1,000 miles struck me as indicative that the sanctions were not working .
Thus the techniques used to manufacture and decorate an object are indicative of its authenticity .
The level of service offered by The Hilton Club is indicative of our commitment to quality now and in the future .

It is perhaps more significant that the political gesture was overturned in favour of more pragmatic financial reasoning -- but this itself is indicative of broader changes in Sheffield 's local politics .
Perhaps the fact that those most frequently bereaved , the very old , have been the subject of so little research in this area , is in itself indicative of ageism amongst the professionals .
Many commentators suggested that the incident was indicative of widespread Japanese assumptions of racial superiority .

That so many disputes were reported in the range of newspapers consulted by Dobson is indicative of a much larger population , either not yet discovered by historians or not reported in their own time .
But those kind of comments are are indicative of the mind of the person making them .

In the adjusted analysis subfertility of the partner became indicative for the fertility of the woman because of the fact that within this subgroup women with lower fertility are over-represented among those entering a donor insemination programme .
Certainly , they precede mosaics of type A , and are thus indicative of at least two individual phases of development .
Rapidly gulping down the first drink ( or starting on spirits before changing to beer or wine ) may be indicative of craving for the " feel " of alcohol .
The development of ` fast track " procedures , such as those referred to here for assessment changes is indicative of mounting concern .
To her it was indicative of how he 'd come to view their relationship .
That Navarro Rubio should stand up to Franco in this way was indicative of how power relations within the regime had changed since the Civil War .
To take a single indicative example that this might be so we can turn our attention to a star cluster named by the ancient Greeks the Pleiades , or Seven Sisters .
The settlement is for next year only and the three-year planning system is discontinued ; from now on figures for future years will only be indicative .
Her remark was indicative not only of the close and exclusive family structure , but also of the petty rivalries and jealousies ( in this case directed at my mother ) within it .
